title: Toddler killed by hit-and-run driver in front of parents as she played in her driveway
text:
Giselle Quiroz was reportedly killed by a hit-and-run driver as she played in her driveway under her parents’ supervision. (Picture: WTHR/ RTV6)

A toddler was struck and killed by a hit-and-run driver as her parents watched her play in their driveway.

Giselle Quoriz’s family said the 21-month-old was playing in front of her home in Indianapolis, Indiana when she was hit by a four-dour sedan on Sunday evening.

The toddler’s parents were outside with Giselle when she was hit by the gray sedan that reportedly left the roadway and entered the driveway – then sped off without stopping, according to WTHR.

Officers responded the incident on North Tibbs Avenue after a witness called 911 to report a person laying on the sidewalk.

When authorities arrived, a family member flagged down officers as they were taking Giselle to the hospital.

Giselle was rushed to Riley Hospital in critical condition, but she was later pronounced dead.

The Indianapolis Metropolitan Police Department still looking for the driver of the sedan, who they said was a man in a gray or gold vehicle.
description: Police are still looking for the driver that sped away after hitting 21-month-old Giselle Quiroz in Indianapolis, Indiana.
